In North America he's creating consensus on Chrysler before its initial public offering, while in Italy he needs to shock the country into creating a more competitive environment. Fiat's 22,000 auto workers in Italy assembled 650,000 cars in 2009, compared with 600,000 made by 6,100 employees at the company's factory in Tychy, Poland.
